will be the Mountain View Internet juggernaut's new CEO starting April 4, and current CEO Eric Schmidt will be executive chairman, Eric Schmidt revealed in a post today on Google's blog. Co-founder Sergey Brin , meanwhile, has decided to devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products. His title will be co-founder. He's an innovator and entrepreneur to the core, and this role suits him perfectly, Eric Schmidt said. "As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated," Eric Schmidt wrote. chief executive in a surprising management reshuffling announced with the Internet company's fourth-quarter earnings, which jumped 29%. The Mountain View, Calif., company said the moves, effective April 4, were made to streamline decision-making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. Instead, he will become exective chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships.
